meanings.definition: A tower or turret used for observation or defense.
meanings.sent1: The ancient castle had atalayas that overlooked the entire kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers climbed the atalayas to keep watch for any approaching enemies.
meanings.sent3: The atalayas in the fortress were so tall that they could see far beyond the walls.
meanings.sent4: The atalayas stood like silent guardians, protecting the castle from any threats.
meanings.sent5: From the top of the atalayas, one could see the vast landscape stretching out before them.

meanings.definition: A person who keeps watch or acts as a lookout.
meanings.sent1: The atalayas spotted the ship approaching the shore.
meanings.sent2: The atalayas were always vigilant, scanning the horizon for any signs of danger.
meanings.sent3: The atalayas joked that they had eyes like hawks, never missing a thing.
meanings.sent4: She was the atalayas of the group, always on the lookout for trouble.
meanings.sent5: The atalayas stood watch through the night, ensuring the safety of the village.
